Reviews.Title: “you can't expect more!”
Reviews.Author: Kisso
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in April 2012. We had two rooms (both twin), one on the 2nd floor facing (a rather ugly) courtyard, one on the 5th floor facing the street. Both were quiet. The lift was sufficiently fast and we did not notice any queues. The rooms were clean and by Parisian standards both were of decent size. Probably the only thing to improve is the mattresses, they can be too soft for one's liking. The location is very good, close to several metro stops (Oberkampf and Republique, both on the direct line M5 from Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est) and canal Saint-Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Smart simple Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnerleyCathy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times for work and have found it to be a great option for my price bracket - the location is great for where I need to be, the rooms are clean, simple and modern and the staff very friendly and helpful. I can't comment on the breakfast as it seemed a bit pricey to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Justin S
Reviews.Content: A hotel in good location not far from the Marais district. Well renovated with modern decor in the rooms.Staff very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast buffet good but a touch pricey at 12 euros. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Little modern gem in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: Modern comfort hotel with all necessary amenities. Well no restaurant or pool, but mainly all other things you can have in a central-Paris old building. Great looks inside (street itself not that large) but close to Place de La République. Welcoming staff that is largely internationally oriented and fluent in English. The rooms are decent in terms of size, but modern and offer good sleeping and showering. Well-kept and the hotel has a bright and open atmosphere. For some reasons there was no possibility to pay by credit card when checking out, but the staff took it very well (as I was a bit in a hurry). Reception 24 hours and many services (including free wifi) available. I stayed here before, but again no negative comments

Reviews.Title: “Smart, friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Julianne M
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel, so I had no idea what to expect, but given the reasonable price I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is quite central and walking distance to a number of metro stations; the decor is bright, modern and funky and the staff were very friendly and helpful (with no language issues encountered either!). We didn't have the hotel breakfast as we wanted a more authentic breakfast experience - there were loads of cafes within walking distance, so we were never caught short! Would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Georgina N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2011. We found the hotel hard to find. The Republique metro station is a five minute brisk walk, but difficult with suitcases! The rooms are clean and tidy but small (that is expected for Paris). One staff member was very nice and helpful but night staff were rude. Breakfast good! Overall a funky little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: paris t
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we loved the hotel and the staff seemed extremely helpful. However after our second night in woke to find that I had been bitten over 28 times by what appeared to be bed bugs which we were able to confirm after visiting the pharmacy and examining the bed. We were moved hotels with little explanation and no management were avaliable for us to discuss the matter with. The hotel said they would email us, but we have heard nothing.This incident effectively ruined the rest of our holiday and I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “victim of its success”
Reviews.Author: Christophemallorca
Reviews.Content: I have come several times to this hotel over the last few years, but every time I come there is something to disappoint me: 1) Price: it is now something like 30% more expensive (depending on the deal you get) than it was when I started to go there just 2 years ago. At this price, there are much better options in Paris, especially considering how small and basic the rooms are. 2) Internet: that is the biggest joke.... Wifi has never worked properly in this hotel. There has not been a single time I was there when wifi has worked properly. The argument is always the same (all with a smile, at least): we have tried, we have changed ISP...we will reinitialise the router...But the result is that wifi is totally unreliable - it works for 2 minutes, then nothing for the next 20 minutes (mornings seem to be a bit better). So if you are on a business trip, forget about this hotel 3) Breakfast: the breakfast is supposed to be until 11 am on Sunday. However during my last stay, at 10:30 am there was no table available. The receptionist (in a friendly way, admittedly) quickly fixed that, but then I realized that... there was almost no food left. At the price of 12 Euro.... I was better off finding a coffee shop nearby to have breakfast. So... overall very disappointing. The last few times I came to Paris I went to other hotels - this last time I wanted to give it another try. I am not sure I will ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Robyn L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position, its down a quiet street not to far from anything. Just a short cab ride away you can be at most tourist places in Paris. The staff were very friendly and very helpful whether it was directions you were after or a nice place to eat. We would recommend this to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great gem”
Reviews.Author: vcantwerp
Reviews.Content: Very nice contemporary small hotel. Efficiënt And very friendly helpful staff, spacious nice rooms with great beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in Republique area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: gooddog6
Reviews.Content: Nice,hip,small hotel with friendly helpful staff. A few of front desk people spoke English beautifully. Hotel a bit out of the way but easy access to public transportation to all major sites. Rooms were clean but very small, rooms could be noisy with construction next door. Would have liked a few more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: brendan c
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English, the room was clean and quiet and the bed was big and comfortable. It's a good location, we walked everywhere and had a better time for it. About 15-20 minutes to the Seine, Notre Dame, Pompidou etc. We didn't have the breakfast but while some say €12 is a lot, it's not that much relative to Paris prices... Either way, there's a good boulangerie just around the corner towards Oberkampf metro, and can recommend strolling down past the metro station and onto Rue Vielle du Temple and heading towards the river for some good side streets, cafes and quirky shops. Things could always be improved - a full sized bath, tea and coffee facilities would be nice - but you get what you pay for, and this was just about right. It's a comfortable, clean and friendly hotel. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sued0t
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this pleasant and well located hotel. It is just a few minutes walk from the metro. There is a bakery, a dry cleaners, a laundromat and a small grocery store close by and a great fruit and vegetable market. It is a perfect base to explore Paris from, without being right in the middle of tourist town. Breakfast downstairs is lovely, and there are lots of cafes closeby. Note there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, although there is small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “A bit small & bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Osseja_01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. It is new and nice looking. I would only complani about two items: room space and price. Rooms are small. It is not important if you travel alone, but if you travel in couples, and you have to hang a suit and a coat forget it. Everything is very small, and makes me remember about a film form max brothers. Beds are also small. Price is not cheap, and you can have nice & better quality/cost proposals from hotels in the same area. Breakfast was charged as an addition to room price, and made the hotel expensive. On the good area, wifi worked fine and the hotel is quite new and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely area”
Reviews.Author: DashaNova
Reviews.Content: I love the area around this hotel. There is a very charming Saint Denis canal just steps away and there are plenty of great places to go out in the evening. Probably no the best place for first comers to Paris as you want to be more central, but perfect to for a leisurely weekend. The hotel itself clean, quirky, helpful english speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bman32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on a quiet side street. Very nice presentation from outside and in the lobby. Staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. When we discovered our initial room on the fourth floor hadn't been cleaned, they immediately switched us to a room on the fifth floor with a balcony. That really made all the difference in giving this an excellent recommendation. We stayed in a triple, and it was a fairly small triple in comparison with some others we had stayed in. However, the balcony provided the added space we needed. It was very relaxing to sit out on the balcony and enjoy the beautiful view. The bathroom was very nice and modern with hairdryer included. No washcloths. Refrigerator and safe in the closet. Internet connection was not perfect, but staff offered their own computer when we wanted to try and check in to our flight online. Not all staff spoke good English, which was difficult at times, but we made due. The elevator was very small and a bit slow, but we actually enjoyed the alternative spiral staircase immensely. We had a bit of a misunderstanding about our taxi arrangements. The staff member the night before had told us it would be 45 euro. A different staff member arranged the taxi for us in the morning and set up an upscale taxi that was 55 euro. It was too late to make a change by the time we realized the error.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a funky design and is really nicely finished. The rooms are small, typical of Paris, but have everything you need and space is well utilised. The location isn't central but is safe and nice, and only a few metro stops from where you want to go. One thing to note is don't miss breakfast - we couldn't find anywhere nearby to eat the day we did! The staff are friendly and helpful. And the hotel feels secure. Breakfast was self service and a small but good quality array. All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Hermes99
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and well situated, the Hotel 20 Le Prieuré is a great place to stay in Paris. Although our room was small (with only one small chair), there was a small work desk, our bed was very comfortable, and the overall effect was very pleasant. There was an effective air conditioner (much appreciated one day when the temp outside was 29 deg C), and with the double glazed windows closed, the room was very quiet – one of the few hotel rooms I have stayed in which is completely quiet at night, with no equipment humming or whirring somewhere in the building. Even the small refrigerator in the closet was completely silent. We did hear some noise from renovations going on in the hotel next door, but it was confined to normal daytime working hours and didn’t bother us. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from both the République and the Oberkampf metro stations, and quite close to both the Gare du Nord, where the RER from Charles De Gaulle airport stops and the Eurostar train starts, and the Gare du Lyon, terminus for TGV trains to the south of France. (Our cab fare from the Gare du Nord to the hotel was less than 10 Euros.) There are shops and restaurants at the Place de la République and near the Oberkampf metro. Breakfast, served in the hotel basement, is excellent, with a wide choice of breads, cereal, fruit, yogurt, ham, cheese, eggs for boiling, juice, coffee and tea, although it is somewhat expensive at 12,50 €. Free, unlimited Wi Fi goes someway to compensating, and there are several boulangeries and cafes within less than five minutes walk where you can get a good breakfast for less. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design Hotel Boutique in Paris city center!”
Reviews.Author: SpicyCinderella
Reviews.Content: One night spent in this hotel was nice. The design is nice and very modern. The bed was firm. The room was large (compared to average hotel rooms in Paris), very clean, not noisy. Bathroom was ok, but the bathtub a bit small. Nice lobby with a good security. As we were leaving very early, we did not take breakfast, so I can't tell. definitively, I would go back while passing via Paris as I kept a good souvenir of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Matthew F
Reviews.Content: With my multiple trips to Paris and different hotels I have stayed at I would say this is the best hotel in all Paris. The rooms are calm, modern and clean, they have beautiful bathrooms and the beds are more than comfortable. All the staff was speaking english with us (this is still rare in Paris) and was always ready to help with any type of questions. The breakfast is real french so if you want to have breakfast like true french, just go downstairs. My overall experience was really great and I will definitely stay there again (and recommend to all of my friends).

Reviews.Title: “Noisey construction - great hotel once the noise ends!!”
Reviews.Author: pablo360
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is well situated near local transport in Paris. Metro stops Le Republique & Oberkampf are within walking distance. Easily accessible from Gare du Nord train station. Be aware that currently there is CONSTRUCTION in the hotel nextdoor. Unfortunately I was given a room that had a common wall with the nextdoor hotel. There was drilling, banging etc from around 830am weekday mornings. There is no noise on weekends. If you are going to book a room at Hotel le 20 Prieure, I would advise confirming with the hotel that construction has ended. I believe this will be in no time soon! If you do book a room here and are affected by the noise, the hotel staff will not move you to another room. No late checkouts available either under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at this little gem”
Reviews.Author: lessthanlee
Reviews.Content: Out of the way of the busy tourist areas but close by La Republique with it's excellent Metro connections, it's an ideal base to explore Paris from. The room we had (401) was sleek and modern and was above expectations, cant fault any aspect of the room. Staff also were very friendly and helpful. The hotel next door does appear to be undergoing some major refurbishment work and the builders may be heard on occasions from mid-morning onwards, but it's one of those things which the hotel cant control and wasn't an issue for us. Would definitely return again in the future, and highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “FAB FAB MODERN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jeneicebrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my first trip to Paris. I was part of a group from Jamaica which included children. I found the hotel to be quite modern, and environmentally aware. The staff were pleasant and willing to assist with our every request and were especially patient with the children. The location is close to great restaurants and train routes. The breakfast which was included was an added plus with fresh fruits and scrumptious pastries every morning. Our stay was made perfect by this Hotel and i would certainly stay there again and encourage others looking for a good priced hotel with A1 Service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel well located for Gare de Nord”
Reviews.Author: CGDLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - once before heading on holiday further south in France and once on our return. I chose the hotel partly beacause of its location - a few metro stops from Gare de Nord (for Eurostar ) and near to Gare de Lyon where we were getting the TGV to Perpignan. The location was ok and definitely a better option than staying around the area of Gare de Nord. We took the metro to nearby Charonne where there were some good restaurants to eat. In particular we found a really good Algerian restaurnat which served wonderful north African cuisine. The hotel itself was quiet and adequate in terms of space/decor. Bathrooms were good and very clean. We stayed in 2 differernt rooms on the 2 nights we stayed there - both I felt could have done with a touch up of paint and the carperts were rather worn particularly in one of the bedrooms. That said, the hotel was quiet and reasonably priced for Paris. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Give the overpriced breakfast a miss - head towards Oberkampf Metro (5 mins) and you will find some cafes which serve good coffee, croissant etc at half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great location, great staff, quirky design.”
Reviews.Author: Birdyseyeview
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is small but perfectly formed - 25 rooms, with a reasonable amount of space by Paris hotel standards, and newly refurbished to a high standard. Each room has a photographic mural of a Paris landmark on one wall. The three members of staff we met whilst there were all really nice - very casual atmosphere, but keen to help - and between them they seemed to have a good command of most European languages! We didn't take breakfast at hotel - there is a boulangerie at the end of the road (exit hotel and turn left) with good standard French breakfast fare at a much cheaper rate. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to the city. Its just far enough out of the mayhem of tourist traps but with great access into the throngs if you wish. This hotel is situated about 2-3 mins walk from Republic Metro station - so access to Gare du Nord and the rest of the city is easy.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kemer_jadore
Reviews.Content: This is a gem in the 11th arrondissement of Paris. Right by Metro Station "Republique", very well situated in a small and quiet street. Friendly welcoming by a young man at reception. There were green and gorgeous looking apple and croissants at reception for you to take. I thought it was quite nice. The hotel has been recently renovated and the room was really nice and modern. It was clean and as for the size I would say it was really good for Paris. The only little thing that we didn't like was the smell of fresh paint when we first arrived in the room. Well we left the window open, spent the evening out and when we got back, the smell was gone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris this is a little gem I can assure you.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated accommodations, genuine staff; truly Paris!”
Reviews.Author: anthonytravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le 20 Prieure for 1 night and it completely lived up to my expectations. First, the staff are outstanding. They were polite, accommodating and sincere and I genuinely appreciated their high standard of service. Second, the location is perfect, easy walking distance to so many charming neighbourhoods, interesting boutiques, shops, museums and Metro stations. I had a single room on the 6th floor and it was small, but larger than I had anticipated. It was immaculate, and well laid out. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked! The room was well furnished, simple, uncrowded, contemporary but not cold or cheap. It felt like the perfect Parisan apartment! The bathroom had a standing shower and was clean and nicely appointed. I would definitely stay here again and recommend you do as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Spotless - Warm welcome Hetrofriendly”
Reviews.Author: tankerton1944
Reviews.Content: This gay run hotel is close to the metro and bus routes and is just out side the Marais being in the 11th district. Modern interior. Hotel has a lift. In a side street so no traffic noise. Local bars, cafes and restaurants. are not intrusive. Local shops close, and large stores near metro. Good selection breakfast at (2011) an additiona € 12.50. Reasonable price for what is offered. Air con. Fridge in room. Wi-Fi is free and available throughout hotel. Small lounge at front of hotel. Helpful staff - advice re cafes / bars / restaurants. Will arrange taxis etc. Well run without losing any of his charm. Staff tend to be young and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Little "Parisienne" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yahooholidays
Reviews.Content: It’s a small hotel that is very close to Republic metro station. There’s just the one helpful guy on reception; no bar or restaurant. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and a supermarket in the immediate area. The surrounding area felt safe, even in the early hours of the morning Rooms are comfortable, clean, modern and nicely decorated in a Parisienne theme. They have Flat panel TV, air conditioning that really works, a fridge (but no contents) and safe that’s big enough to take a full sized laptop. Wi-Fi is free and is fast enough for VoIP calls. Staff were pleasant, helpful and efficient. They have croissants and fruit at reception which is a nice touch. I didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment on that. It was great to stay in a Paris hotel that actually felt “Parisienne” yet still had thoughtful touches and offered value for money. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: roby_swiss
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a quiet area. Very clean and confortable. Rooms are not so big but are really good designed. Near the hotel there are two metro stations and some bar / boulangerie for the breakfast. I really enjoyed this hotel and I would recommend it to everyone! Next time I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Paris Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: WHHH
Reviews.Content: Over the last 4 years I stayed at about 20 different hotels in Paris (3 to 5 Star) and it's a pity that I discovered Le 20 Prieure only now. The location next to the metro station "Republique" is perfect for leisure and business. The rooms are tasteful, quiet and clean, which leads to a value / price relation that is great. But most of all, the entire staff is providing a friendly service that's hard to find at any other Paris hotel. I felt very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “" Noise from Hotel ruined my trip"”
Reviews.Author: DDL72
Reviews.Content: I made an advanced booking in November 2010 for a week’s stay in February 2011 at Le 20 Prieure Hotel and requested a quiet room. On arrival I discovered my request was ignored and I was given room 101 on the first floor next to the fire exit. On the 5th day of my stay I went for a light breakfast at about 7.30am and returned to my room at 8.15am for further rest. At about 8.15am to my surprise I heard noise pertaining to the nature of banging pipes, scraping of walls, drilling and men talking. This noise emanated from the fire exit next to my room. The following morning the noise occurred again. The noise was such that I started to feel distress and decided to see the manager Benoit [-], Director General and the front of desk staff (Alex) who seemed to collude with each other. First Alex looked unbothered about what I saying, then he claimed not to be aware of works being carried out, and then he refused to come and listen because he claimed the hotel was fully booked and he couldn’t leave the reception area. I returned to the reception area a second time and spoke to Alex because the persistent noise wouldn’t allow me to relax or sleep. This time he told me the banging I could hear was from the central heating. I was so distressed by this time that I took my complaint to the Manager (Benoit [-], Directeur General) who appeared to be very arrogant. He told me the noise I heard was coming from another hotel, and then he admitted there was noise coming from the Hotel but it did not start until 9.15 am. The manager was not present when the noise was occurring on the 5th and 6th day. I never received an apology. I had to insist for the manager to come to my room and witness the noise, only then was I moved to another room. When I asked the manager for the owner’s details he told me no he deals with all the complaints. This was my second and will be the last time I stay at le 20 Prieure Hotel. I would most definitely not recommend this hotel to ANY traveller as I experienced the most unpleasant dealing with these people.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Republique area”
Reviews.Author: jscHongKong
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this discreet and beautifully styled hotel. The staff were so helpful and even helped me to check in for my flight online. The room was well designed, the bed comfortable and the bathroom functioned well. The buffet breakfast was good too. I would definitely return as it offered incredible value

Reviews.Title: “Le 20 Prieure made my trip a even better trip”
Reviews.Author: CCLovetravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Le 20 Prieure for my leisure trip. I really liked this hotel because the room was spacious in a reaonsable standard and it was clean. I booked this hotel early and was able to enjoy the "early bird price" which made the room price affordable. This is a charming and quiet hotel, the location was good, easy to go anywhere. Nice bakery supermarket, restaurants and morning market are around the corner. I was very impressed by the attentive staff. They were very friendly, helpful and cheerful

Reviews.Title: “A Good Rest- under the "Eiffel Tower." !”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: Yes, the headboard for our beds was a wall -sized photo of the Eiffel Tower.!!! This Hotel is on a quiet side street in the Place Republic area, near two Metro stops, with a nice variety of typical Parisian neighbor-type shops nearby. Room was clean and good- sized by Paris Hotel standards. Bathroom was roomy with up-to-date fixtures. Buffet Breakfast was certainly adequate with very attentive service. Finally, cannot say enough good things about the young,energetic english speaking front-desk staff. They went out of their way to meet our every request... and succeed they did. Thanks to all.. "Le 20 Prieure" = highly reccomended.. .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Christophemallorca
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but comfortable, and the bathroom is well fitted. The decoration is very nice - modern but not the kind of pretentious design you find in other hotels, just lovely. The breakfast is great, varied and very well presented- including trendy and tasty Nespresso machines. The staff is incredibly friendly - smiling and willing to help. I think this is a little gem... The location is great, not in the middle of the touristy quarter, but close enough to le marais - the nearby area, with the square du temple, rue de bretagne, and marché DES enfants rouges is very Parisian and lovely

Reviews.Title: “Great, stylish little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaipurjane
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from Paris. Le Prieure 20 is great - the rooms are small, but stylish and recently refurbished so the carpets, bedding and curtains are all fresh, and the bathroom fittings modern and wonderfully designed to make the most of the space. Loved my view - over the rooftops of Paris- very romantic and poetic! Reception areas and art work trendy, staff lovely and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem - fabulous hotel in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: MPC28
Reviews.Content: This is a real find. Granted our room wasn't huge but it was very clean and well-appointed with some fab artwork. The bathroon was a generous size with lovely new fittings. The staff on the desk were very helpful. The location is perfect - a short walk to Canal St Martin and on to the Bastille area. A great neighbourhood with interesting cafe bars and restaurants. I'm already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterMoo2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Nov 2010 with 2 friends in a triple room. We had a room on the 3rd floor. The hotel was very clean and in a good location for the price. The room was large enough by Paris standards with 2 large double windows that opened onto the street. The rooms were quiet - we heard no other TVs or guests from our room. We walked into the Marais every day (about 15 mins walk) down Vielle du Temple. Metro stops 3 mins walk away. The breakfast was €12, and worth buying if you are hungry - buffet with juices as well as a fresh juice machine, fresh fruit (including strawberries and raspberries some days) filter coffee and N'espresso machine/tea/hot chocolate. Ham, selection of cheeses, tomatoes, yoghurts, eggs (with egg boiler) Baguettes, Croissants, (butter and selection of jams) Pain au choc/raisan. The tables were cleared regularly and the buffet replenished constantly. (much better than a coffee and a bread basket that you get in most Paris Hotels). Staff were friendly. The only negative was that the lift didnt work sometimes - not a huge problem - the stairs were wide and bright and easy to access. (I would go back)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, recently renovated and friendly staf.”
Reviews.Author: tsmartins
Reviews.Content: I have just return from my trip to Paris. The hotel is very clean, recently renovated, looks exactly like the photos on the hotel site. The staff was friendly but we had some troubles communicating in English. I had to cut my trip short and the hotel was able to accommodate my new plans without penalties. It is not close to any tourist attraction, but not far by metro, less than 10 minutes distance from the main attractions. The neighborhood has several options of restaurants opened at reasonable hours. Would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: natjones7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for what we wanted. It was a very modern hotel with great design through the rooms and all of the common areas. The artwork on the walls was great.....much more interesting than you usually get in hotels. The room was a decent size....not massive, but plenty of room for suitcases etc. It was immaculate everywhere.....very, very clean and not worn at all. Very simple design and stylish furniture and furnishings. As per the other reviews, the staff were excellent. They were very friendly and helpful with restaurant reservations etc. We had a slight issue when checking in as the first 2 rooms we got allocated were still being cleaned. But this really didn't matter as the young man on reception dealt with it brilliantly and efficiently, even offering us a free breakfast the following day to apologise. It wasn't an issue at all, but they were very apologetic. Great location....close to Marais and Bastille and easy for access to all of Paris. One of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. I would recommend this to anyone and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: AGvanderWesthuizen
Reviews.Content: The French are know for not very friendly people, but you will change you thoughts once you have met the reception staff of the Le 20 Prieure Hotel. What a warm welcome! The management was happy to speak English and was most helpful. The rooms are cosy. There is an elevator. Breakfast is good. Rooms are cosy with everything you need. The hotel not badly located. Close to transport. Will love to go back again. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly and a good deal....despite no bathplug”
Reviews.Author: mexo
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends stayed here for 2 nights. Although with 3 beds, 3 suitcases and 3 lots of shopping bags it was "snug", it was also clean, quiet and comfortable. The decor is stylish and bright. It was disappointing that there was no bath plug as a nice soak for tired feet was preferable to a shower, however the shower was hot and there were plenty of clean towels. The location is excellent, being a 10 minute walk from Canal St Martin, 5 minutes from Republique, 15 minutes from the heart of Le Marais and 5 minutes from Oberkampf. Every contact with reception was a friendly and helpful encounter. We had no breakfast included in our deal, but there was a bowl of fruit and croissants on the desk everyday from which to nibble. This was a very charming extra touch. One afternoon we came in shattered from shopping and needed a cup of tea. We were accompanied down to the breakfast area and invited to make it to take to our room. Again, a welcoming gesture that they didn't have to do. We were recommended a nearby restaurant on the final night. I am always wary of restaurants with cards at hotel receptions, as they are often tourist traps, but this was a genuine neighborhood restaurant at which we had a lovely dinner. Following an unfortunate (and unusual) experience with an untrustworthy cab, on the day of our departure, the young man on reception talked to our taxi driver and went out of his way to ensure we had a worry free ride to the station. All three of us would recommend this hotel without hesitation and found it to be extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - typically french with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: abi_SouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and a friend stayed here in May for a short break to Paris. The room was a triple and big enough for the three of us. From what you read in the reviews of Paris hotels before you go, you're given an idea of what to expect; so yes, the room is small, but it was more than adequate for our 2 night stay. It had a beautiful sort of painting/picture on the one wall; very nice. The bathroom was clean, and the room made up each day. Everything was clean. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate so cannot comment on that. We just did starbucks as it was the only place we could really find where croissants weren't the only thing available ;) We each bought a three day travel 'card' so had no problem moving around the city using the subways and busses. So although the hotel is not really super close to any main tourist attractions, its easy to get to them. Paris is very expensive!!! So be prepared to spend a lot of money! (a coke is like €4) But yes, it was wonderful to see the eiffel tower, especially with its sparkling lights at night, as well as all the other attractions Paris has to offer. The staff at our hotel were really very helpful; they always helped out where they could with restaurant suggestions or giving directions. They also helped us to print out our flight info before heading to the airport. Thank you! A nice short break to Paris for a reasonable cost; this hotel did the job.

Reviews.Title: “have already recommended it to friends”
Reviews.Author: SadieT
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for the last weekend in Januar for total cost of 270 Euro - and we couldn't have asked for a better stay at such a great price. On arrival (by metro, just around the corner from Oberkampf station - no longer than a 5 minute walk max) we were met by a clean, bright, warm reception, and friendly English speaking receptionist who couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was (seems a shame to complain about this!!) too warm and all 3 of us found it unbearably hot during the night which made it uncomfortable to sleep in at times. That would be the only negative I could say and we really enjoyed our stay here. Plus points: cleanliness top rate (I stayed in a 4 star Irish hotel the weekend before and this Parisien jewel was miles ahead of the Irish stay), contemporary decor throughout, lift to all floors, great breakfast, helpful staff (offered to book us taxis to airport, gave us recommendations on local eateries, gave us access to a PC and printer to print boarding tickets for our journey home), location fab. Minus point: too hot!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel stay destroyed by financial shenanigans”
Reviews.Author: Ger2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a city break in Oct 2009. The location was good and although the rooms were a bit pokey the decor was decent. For a Paris hotel it would have been considered quite acceptable at the price. The problem for us started on departure! We actually booked the hotel through lastminute.com but as we were checking out we were assured that they had actually charged us and we had to pay at the hotel. We did so but on inspecting my credit card bill I found I had been double billed. I contacted the hotel immediately but got absolutely no reply at all so after a week I contacted lastminute.com. They contacted the hotel who assured them I would be refunded if I sent my bank details on immediately. This I did but no payment was forthcoming. To make a long story short for the next 2 months I contacted either the hotel or lastminute.com once a week with no refund forthcoming. The hotel blatantly lied on several occasions telling lastminute.com reps that the a) they had sent the money and it must be delayed in transit (but were unable to back this up with a bank reference number) and then b) they said I hadn't furnished them with the necessary financial details. When the payment finally came through it was using details I sent them forwarded from my very first email. To add insult to injury the refund was €6.35 short for no apparent reason and I still have never received this amount. I have no idea was all this messing the result of sharp practice or incompetence but it very much sapped the good of our otherwise enjoyable city break.

Reviews.Title: “A great time in Paris - both in spite of and because of this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesFlamantsRoses
Reviews.Content: Le 20 Prieuré is a handsome little hotel. I'm not convinced that €389 for a small room (B&B 3 nights) in a small hotel represents the best value for money - I have done better in larger hotels in more expensive European cities. I'll let you decide. I don't need English speaking staff or help to get taxis or find my way around this gorgeous city, but if you're likely to need help with these things, the reception staff here are very good. An unbelievably noisy femme de ménage who waged war cleaning neighbouring rooms spoiled a much needed quiet afternoon on my second day, but overall my stay was a harmonious one. I've deleted two previous reviews which points to my ambivalent feelings towards this place. Why? Well, French pride is a hard nut to crack - and Parisian pride? I've had a second home in Nimes for 18 years, so I'm used to banks, hospitals and shops ignoring complaints and failing to respond to criticism. The customer in France is only king when expressing appreciation. My two complaints raised at this hotel were met with surprise and a certain unwillingness to co-operate - but both issues were eventually resolved, though not without, shall we say, un peu de bagarre .. ! And for that reason I am reluctant to recommend this hotel to others. Be that as it may I had a great time in Paris, both in spite of and because of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: omfalcon
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel very comfortable, the room is small, tipical, but the bed, the pillows and the sheets are very good for this kind of Hotel. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful, the breakfast is very good, there is nespresso coffee and delicious breads, even for Paris standards, the location could be better, but it is a ten minutes walk from place de Voges, the metro line is number 6.. We would stay there another time. We are tryng to write a clear and helpful review, but let's just say that fells good to stay there and be welcomed with a smile and nice music and sleep in a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, convenient for city break”
Reviews.Author: HonestScot
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal location and room for a city break. Good sized rooms, very clean, large bathroom and very handy for transport (about 2-300 m from Republic metro station). Great value at 99 euros/night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: elaineb2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend at the prieure hotel - it was within walking distance of the centre of the marais - with nice cafe's, boutiques and markets. The rooms were lovely - we got a ground floor room with a little garden that we could use to smoke and have drinks in the evening. It was very quiet and the staff were very sweet and helpful. We didn't bother having the breakfast as there were lots of cafes down the road - but be careful - in some of these a cappucino was 6 euros! Top Marks! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week-end of August (room 205 - twin room). We had a very nice stay at this hotel. It's located close to the Marais and la Bastille. Near the hotel there are also plenty of Velib (www.velib.fr) bicycle stations. Rooms are spacious (Paris norms), nice bathroom, safe in room, free wireless internet, great service, breakfast was OK. We'll be back soon!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Le 20 Prieure
HotelInfo.Address: 20, Rue Du Grand Prieure, 75011 Paris, France
